website_summaries.verdict: Small, colorful microfiber towels of high quality.
cons: Not as thick as some would like

customer_reviews.title: Any microfiber towel attracts dirt like no other
customer_reviews.text: No frills, but that's what you pay for. A simple and basic microfiber towel. I purchased these because I don't understand why you'd buy the small version, which soaks full of water in two seconds while you are washing your car (because its just so small). WARNING: Any microfiber towel attracts dirt like no other. If you drop it onto the ground, you have to painfully pick out each bit of debris that it collected, because washing them won't get the debris out. So I keep my microfiber towels in a sealed box or bag while i'm not using them, and I am careful to never drop them on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wurzel

customer_reviews.title: Great, wait for low price
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I use them on my car for various things, usually to dry the car after a wash. Wait until they are lower in price, this set of 3 should occasionally drop down to the $3 range. The first time I bought a pack they were up at $6. The prices on a lot of AmazonBasics products fluctuate a lot. Just add them to your list and keep an eye on them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT ultra thick as claimed
customer_reviews.text: The description from the manufacturer says ultra thick. I'd hate to see what thin is! Microfiber cloths used to be nice and thick. That's NOT what these are. They do absorb quite a bit of water, but pale in comparison to old microfiber cloths I bought 10 years ago. I like the larger size (they are longer than others) and will use them, but I'm horribly disappointed that they are not thick as my old ones. Does anyone make real thick cloths any more? UPDATE: My review is getting hidden by the "sensitivity filter"? What about this review is "sensitive"? Editing - trying to find out what is "sensitive".
